task_summary: Pick up the red object from the table using a robot arm as visually evidenced in frames 0–8.

task_long_description.overview: The robot arm is positioned above a table with several blue rectangles and a single red object (cylinder), as shown in frames 0–8. The task is to localize, approach, and securely grasp the red object, then lift it from the table. Perception validates the object's presence, followed by a precise approach, gentle grasp, and vertical lift. Task constraints include gentle handling and reliable object detection under occlusion or partial view.
preconditions: Robot is above and unobstructed from the red object
Red object is on the table, not already grasped
Gripper is free and opened to at least 0.08m width
stepwise_plan: Verify visibility of the red object or scan for it
Detect the precise pose of the red object
Move directly above the red object with an appropriate offset
Approach and align with the object
Lower until gentle contact with the object is made
Verify that the object is in the gripper
Raise the object above table to complete the pick
success_criteria: Red object securely held in gripper
Red object lifted above the table
failure_and_recovery: Object not visible: retry scan up to 3 times
Contact not detected: abort grasp or retry approach
Grasp fails: reattempt approach and grasp if allowed
task_long_description.termination: Tree terminates after object is confirmed in the gripper and lifted above the table.

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

task_instruction: pick up the red object from the table

node_specs.description: Checks if the red object is visible.
Scans for the visible red object using a grid pattern up to 3 attempts.
Detects the precise pose and parameters of the red object.
Opens the robot gripper to 8cm for pregrasp.
Moves end effector above the red object with a 5cm vertical offset.
Approaches and aligns gripper to the red object.
Lowers the gripper at slow speed until contact with 5N threshold or 5cm depth.
Checks if the red object is in the gripper.
Raises the grasped red object 5cm above the table.

failure_modes: Red object not visible due to occlusion or object missing
Collision with table or adjacent objects
recovery_strategy: Rescan area up to 3 times if object not visible
Retry approach if contact not detected
Abort task and alert if grasp fails
assumptions: Red object corresponds to the red cylinder; blue objects ignored as they do not match the instruction.
Frames show only the pick phase (not place), so the BT ends after lifting.
Instruction requests 'pick up', but frames do not show a placement—this is logged as a mismatch but BT aligns to frames.
No evidence of location ambiguity for 'table' in scene.

expected_success_criteria: Red object visibly lifted from table at episode end
